description: Benchmark sites for AEO score calibration, categorized by expected performance

gold_standard.description: Sites that should score 75-90/100. Excellent AEO, widely cited by AI systems

sites.name: Wikipedia - AI Article
sites.reasoning: Comprehensive content, extensive citations, authoritative, highly structured. Missing: JSON-LD schema. Strong in: answerability, authority, content quality

sites.name: Wikipedia - Python Article
sites.reasoning: Similar to AI article, comprehensive technical content with tables, infoboxes, citations

sites.name: Stack Overflow - Top Question
sites.reasoning: Direct answers, code examples, citations, excellent structure. High engagement signals

sites.name: MDN Web Docs - Array
sites.reasoning: Technical documentation gold standard. Clear structure, examples, comprehensive, well-maintained

sites.name: Mayo Clinic - Diabetes
sites.reasoning: Medical gold standard. Expert authorship, citations, structured data, comprehensive, authoritative

excellent.description: Sites that should score 65-75/100. Very good AEO implementation

sites.name: New York Times - Technology
sites.reasoning: Professional journalism, proper authorship, dates, citations. May lack some technical SEO optimizations

sites.name: HubSpot - Marketing Hub
sites.reasoning: Well-optimized marketing content, structured data, clear CTAs, comprehensive guides

sites.name: CSS Tricks - Flexbox Guide
sites.reasoning: Comprehensive tutorial, code examples, visual aids, well-structured

sites.name: Healthline - Vitamin D Foods
sites.reasoning: Health content with medical review, citations, structured data, lists, comprehensive

good.description: Sites that should score 50-65/100. Solid content but room for improvement

sites.name: Medium - Popular Tech Article
sites.reasoning: Good content quality, author info, but limited structured data, fewer citations

sites.name: Reddit - Programming Subreddit
sites.reasoning: Community content, good discussion, but lacks authorship, citations, structured approach

sites.name: W3Schools - HTML Tutorial
sites.reasoning: Clear tutorials, examples, but simplified content, limited citations, basic structure

average.description: Sites that should score 35-50/100. Basic implementation, many missing elements

sites.name: Blogger Platform Page
sites.reasoning: Basic content, limited structure, minimal optimization, commercial focus

poor.description: Sites that should score 15-35/100. Minimal AEO optimization

sites.name: Example.com - Basic HTML
sites.reasoning: Minimal content, no optimization, placeholder site

notes: Wikipedia should score high despite lack of JSON-LD (content quality outweighs schema)
Stack Overflow: Excellent Q&A format should score very high on answerability
Mayo Clinic: Medical content with expert authorship should score highest
MDN: Technical docs should score high on structure and clarity
Medium: Good content but platform limits structured data
Reddit: Community content, less authoritative but high engagement
